contextDescription: Deep dive into Python's object model, memory management, and variable manipulation, exploring object identity, mutability, reference counting, and object-oriented principles in Python.
learningObjectives: Understand why Python programming is awesome
Explain what an object is in Python
Differentiate between a class and an object or instance
Understand the difference between immutable and mutable objects
Define what a reference is in Python
Explain what an assignment is in Python
Know what an alias is in Python
Determine if two variables are identical
Determine if two variables are linked to the same object
Display the variable identifier (memory address) in Python
Understand how Python passes variables to functions
Master the concepts of immutable vs mutable objects
prerequisites: Experience with Object-Oriented Programming in Python

resources.name: Python Documentation - Objects, values and types
Python Tutor - Visualize Python Code Execution
